revised_title: Recent Age for the Human mtDNA Ancestor
tldr: The authors present two approaches to estimate the age of the human mitochondrial DNA (mtDNA) ancestor using intraspecific calibration, which avoids the shortcomings of chimpanzee-human comparisons. The results provide strong evidence for a relatively recent age of the human mtDNA ancestor, with estimates ranging from 133 to 137 thousand years ago. This supports the African origin hypothesis of human mtDNA evolution.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Genetics and Evolution
